title: Ethical Care and Learning Design: Enhancing Practitioner Competencies Through Speculative Methodologies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational learning design theory and practical experience in language education
context.additional_context: Course for practitioners to explore integrated approaches to ethical care and learning design through mobile microlearning, developing job-relevant scenarios using speculative methodologies and receiving continuous feedback via formative assessments.

learning_goals: Three core principles explaining the interaction between learning design and ethical care can be derived.
Ethical dilemma cases in language education settings can be analyzed using speculative methodologies, and alternative design solutions can be proposed.
A mobile-based microlearning module can be designed, and an evaluation checklist reflecting learner care elements can be developed.

resources: Case Study Dataset (Including Anonymized Job Postings)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
